location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Captain Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Commodore George Barnes Brucks, Commanding the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the status of the suspected perpetrator of piracies off the Guttur [Qatar] coast, Jubbur Rugragee [Jassim bin Jaber Raqraqi]. Hennell writes that he regrets reports of Rugragreeâ€™s capture are untrue, and requests the Brucks proceed to Biddah to pay a visit to the Shaikh of that place, Salmin bin Nasir (who is suspected is harbouring Rugragee), and demand that the goods stolen by Rugragee, or their equivalent value, are recovered.
